metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0394 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in rawv6_push_pending_frames innet/ipv6/raw.c in the network subcomponent in the Linux kernel. This flawcauses the system to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-5.4.0-144-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-generic - 5.4.0-144.161
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-144-lowlatency - 5.4.0-144.161
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-70-generic - 5.15.0-70.77~20.04.1
linux-image-5.15.0-70-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-70.77~20.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-144.161').
